newsitem.title: USA: Computer Assocs buys Digital's AssetWORKS.
newsitem.headline: Computer Assocs buys Digital's AssetWORKS.

text.p: Computer Associations International Inc said Thursday it had acquired Digital Equipment Corp's AssetWORKS asset and desktop management solution.

The company, which did not disclose the terms of the deal, said it would integrate AssetWORKS with its CA-Unicenter, a system that gives users more control over costs associated with the use and administration of desktop computers.
"It (AssetWORKS) is a valuable enhancement to CA-Unicenter because it addresses both the technological and business aspects of managing assets," it said.
The company said Digital personnel would join it to continue to help customers use AssetWORKS.
Digital will later resell AssetWORKS as a fully-integrated CA-Unicenter option, or as a stand-alone product, it added.
The company said the acquisition was part of an alliance it formed with Digital earlier this year, which calls for Digital's standardization to be based on CA-Unicenter.
Based in Islandia, N.Y., Computer Associates specializes in business software, while Digital develops open client/server solutions from personal computing to integrated information systems.
